There are people who have something like this power, in that they can convince nearly anyone of whatever they want (as long as it doesn’t clash too much with what the person already believes, or is willing to believe). From reading about his rallies, I suspect that Hitler had this sort of persuasive power. I’ve read stories about people who were extremely opposed to Hitler who came out of one of his rallies thinking he was a great guy. Only later, did they come to their senses, and realize they had been fooled. I suspect that some famous evangelists also shared this ability. I’ve only really met one person who had this ability. He was also very creative and ambitious and had started a vibrant high tech company (~120 employees). Unfortunately, this ability rather spoils a young man. This guy didn’t consider getting married, as he could convince too many women to sleep with him anytime he wanted. (He was famous for being able to ‘pick up’ a stewardess anytime he took an airline flight, for example.) I was reminded of the character in the movie “The Shadow” who could “cloud men’s minds.” I met him when he was pushing 50, however, and I believe that he was beginning to realize that he was missing out on an important part of life. Also, this ability fooled him into thinking that he could handle anything. Unfortunately, only 10 days after I met him, he died in an airplane “accident”. Accident is in scare quotes, since it was entirely preventable — he tried to fly through a gap in a squall line, which closed on him (as such gaps are apt to do) and destroyed his plane.  I’m sure some people could handle an ability like this and make something of it. The guy I met had come close. It would ruin most people, however.

The only way to make everyone agree with you is to state something everyone agrees on. These topics are so superficial and fact-oriented that they are strikingly uninteresting, such as “the ocean is deep in places” or “the cloudless daytime sky is blue.” You can’t argue with that. No, to have a thought that’s worth having, you have to think about things that somebody else sees differently, and you will disagree. You may be able to win over a few people with a good argument, but in general, people are intransigent and will always look for a way to confirm what they already believe rather than screw up their worldview with new information.

The only way to have everyone agree with you is to have opinions so incredibly devoid of insight that they defy rebuttal. Examples: The sun is hot. Water is wet. Unfortunately the flip side of being so mind numbingly agreeable is that everyone will assume you're a moron; which you can't argue against without being disagreeable. I think everyone can agree on that.
